title: How to Make Baked Kibbeh

steps.headline: Put the bulgur inside a bowl and fill it with water.
steps.description: Wait about 20 to 30 minutes and remove the excess of water.

steps.headline: Use a grinder to ground about 80% of both the bulgur, beef and pork together, adding small amounts of mint and basil, into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Remember to ground the ingredients in small amounts, as to not overflow the capacity of the grinder.

steps.headline: Add the black pepper, allspice, nutmeg, salt and cinnamon to the mixture made in the last step and knead.
Using a frying pan and olive oil, lightly brown the onions and pine nuts and pour them on the mixture.
steps.description: Knead more until the olive oil has mixed with the rest of the dough.

steps.headline: Grease your baking tray with a few drops of olive oil and make a layer with ½ of the dough by pressing smaller balls of dough over the tray until it is well spread.
Using the teaspoon of olive oil and the frying pan, fry the rest of the meat, adding more onion if wanted.
Put the fried meat over the layer of dough and spice it with the lemon juice.
Repeat the process from Step 5, only this time you should press the dough with both hands before covering the filling as to not crush the lower parts of the Kibbeh.
steps.description: If necessary, fill in the holes on the top layer of dough, by pressing small amounts of the same dough against them.

steps.headline: Use a knife to cut the raw Kibbeh into small cubes.
steps.description: If wanted, use the same knife to make ornaments on the crust of the Kibbeh by cutting lightly the top layer of dough with the desired shapes.

steps.headline: Put a small ball of butter over every cube of Kibbeh and bake it for 1 hour on a low-medium heat oven.

text: Put the bulgur inside a bowl and fill it with water. Wait about 20 to 30 minutes and remove the excess of water. Use a grinder to ground about 80% of both the bulgur, beef and pork together, adding small amounts of mint and basil, into a mixing bowl. Remember to ground the ingredients in small amounts, as to not overflow the capacity of the grinder. Add the black pepper, allspice, nutmeg, salt and cinnamon to the mixture made in the last step and knead.  Using a frying pan and olive oil, lightly brown the onions and pine nuts and pour them on the mixture. Knead more until the olive oil has mixed with the rest of the dough. Grease your baking tray with a few drops of olive oil and make a layer with ½ of the dough by pressing smaller balls of dough over the tray until it is well spread.  Using the teaspoon of olive oil and the frying pan, fry the rest of the meat, adding more onion if wanted.  Put the fried meat over the layer of dough and spice it with the lemon juice.  Repeat the process from Step 5, only this time you should press the dough with both hands before covering the filling as to not crush the lower parts of the Kibbeh. If necessary, fill in the holes on the top layer of dough, by pressing small amounts of the same dough against them. Use a knife to cut the raw Kibbeh into small cubes. If wanted, use the same knife to make ornaments on the crust of the Kibbeh by cutting lightly the top layer of dough with the desired shapes. Put a small ball of butter over every cube of Kibbeh and bake it for 1 hour on a low-medium heat oven. The recommended temperature is 180ºC (360ºF). Finished.
